snippet: The district judge, Barbara S. Jones, said the First Amendment did not protect the police officer, Craig Matthews, when he complained about a quota system in his Bronx precinct.
abstract: United States District Court Judge Barbara S Jones dismisses a lawsuit accusing a Bronx police precinct of using a strict quota system for arrests and of then punishing Officer Craig Matthews for complaining about it; Jones rejects officer's First Amendment argument, saying his complaint was made pursuant to his job and is therefore not protected.
lead_paragraph: The district judge, Barbara S. Jones, said the First Amendment did not protect the police officer, Craig Matthews, when he complained about a quota system in his Bronx precinct.

headline.seo: Judge Dismisses Bronx Officer’s Lawsuit on Police Quotas
headline.main: U.S. Judge Rejects Officer’s Lawsuit on Quotas
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects an Officer’s Suit on Quotas
